Configure 'Option Strict On' for assembly 'CapaNegocio'.

S101.shortDescription: Class names should comply with a naming convention
S101.fullDescription: Shared naming conventions allow teams to collaborate efficiently.

S107.shortDescription: Procedures should not have too many parameters
S107.fullDescription: Procedures with a long parameter list are difficult to use, as maintainers must figure out the role of each parameter and keep track of their position.

S1542.shortDescription: Functions and procedures should comply with a naming convention
S1542.fullDescription: Shared naming conventions allow teams to collaborate efficiently. This rule checks that all subroutine and function names match a provided regular expression.

S1654.shortDescription: Method parameters should follow a naming convention
S1654.fullDescription: Sharing some naming conventions is a key point to make it possible for a team to efficiently collaborate.

S2375.shortDescription: "With" statements should be used for a series of calls to the same object
S2375.fullDescription: Using the With statement for a series of calls to the same object makes the code more readable.

S2737.shortDescription: "catch" clauses should do more than rethrow
S2737.fullDescription: A Catch clause that only rethrows the caught exception has the same effect as omitting the Catch altogether and letting it bubble up automatically.

S4144.shortDescription: Methods should not have identical implementations
S4144.fullDescription: Two methods having the same implementation are suspicious. It might be that something else was intended. Or the duplication is intentional, which becomes a maintenance burden.

S6145.fullDescription: There are several compilations options available for Visual Basic source code and Option Strict defines compiler behavior for implicit data type conversions. Specifying Option Strict Off will allow:
